events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred at the downtown intersection causing front-end damage.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident as the incident involved a motor vehicle collision.
A claims agent was assigned to the case to provide personalized assistance and oversee the process.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment message confirming receipt of the claim and next steps.
Request was made for police report, photos of vehicle damage, and driver’s license to proceed with evaluation.
Customer submitted all required documents, including police report and photos of the damaged vehicle.
Investigation initiated to assess liability and estimate repair costs for the damaged car.
Investigation report completed confirming fault and detailing damage assessments from the accident.
An initial settlement offer was proposed covering repair expenses and associated costs.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer and requested prompt processing of payment.
The claim was formally approved by the claims manager after verifying all investigation results.
The insurance payment was successfully issued to the customer’s bank account to cover damages.
The claim was officially closed after confirming receipt of payment and customer satisfaction.
